channel.title: KDE plasma widgets error :(
channel.description:
When I try adding a plasma widget using the KDE add widgets window, it gives me this error: http://img294.imageshack.us/img294/144/errorm.png
I'm using Ubuntu 9.04 with KDE desktop.

item.title: KDE plasma widgets error :(
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:15, topic:282072”][quote author=bjc22 link=topic=372716.msg2814210#msg2814210 date=1244175799]

KDE

There’s your problem.

There is nothing wrong with KDE, in my experience it is far superior to GNOME at every turn.

I agree, I think GNOME is too basic.
[/quote]
Isn’t really basic, just bloated and sucks compared to XFCE.[/quote]

I agree, I don’t see why anyone would use GNOME over XFCE.

Read full topic

item.title: KDE plasma widgets error :(
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“kloplop321, post:5, topic:282072”]no no no
it may be a permission problem, or it may be that what ever the widget manager is doing is wrong on determining a temporary path, I would suggest you reinstall the widget manager “plasmoid” if you can. As you have a clean install, I doubt it is your fault, and reinstalling should put you exactly where you are now(unfortunately)[/quote]

alright, so just uninstall plasmoid and reinstall it, simple enuf. Thank you kloplop321, will try.

I guess its kinda difficult to uninstall, plasmoid.

Just uninstalled KDE completely.

Read full topic

item.title: KDE plasma widgets error :(
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

no no no
it may be a permission problem, or it may be that what ever the widget manager is doing is wrong on determining a temporary path, I would suggest you reinstall the widget manager “plasmoid” if you can. As you have a clean install, I doubt it is your fault, and reinstalling should put you exactly where you are now(unfortunately)

Read full topic

item.title: KDE plasma widgets error :(
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“kloplop321, post:3, topic:282072”]no it is not io9.
it seems that someone else has a problem with this, it may be caused by an update not properly tested
http://osdir.com/ml/ubuntu-users/2009-04/msg03858.html

you can try “sudo chmod 0777 -R /tmp/kde-sam/”
it should provide you with write access to that folder, though there should not be three “/” in the location, the manager that installs them, or at least prepares them must be having an issue[/quote]
So, I delete one of the folders? This bug is pretty common I guess. Or should I just reinstall KDE?

Read full topic

item.title: KDE plasma widgets error :(
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

no it is not io9.
it seems that someone else has a problem with this, it may be caused by an update not properly tested
http://osdir.com/ml/ubuntu-users/2009-04/msg03858.html

you can try “sudo chmod 0777 -R /tmp/kde-sam/”
it should provide you with write access to that folder, though there should not be three “/” in the location, the manager that installs them, or at least prepares them must be having an issue

Read full topic
